lexUnit.name: incomprehensible.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not able to be understood

sentence.text: As Smith commented , it is incomprehensible that Moorcroft does not appear to have been considered for appointment as the first Professor of the London College .
The work of those seventeenth-century poets who created poems in the shape of diamonds or butterflies would be largely incomprehensible if the form were not preserved .
There were other stated symptoms , too , including singing or chanting odd songs -- and what child has not spent time happily singing something totally incomprehensible to a parent ?
Like Khomeini a quarter of a century later , he was almost totally incomprehensible to many western Europeans and Americans .
This delectable prose is no doubt clear -- and quite incomprehensible to the ordinary voter .

Her arms hugged around herself , she stood in the phone-box for a long time after she 'd replaced the receiver and it seemed quite incomprehensible to her now that she had n't contacted her mother before .
The Theban Herald clearly finds this almost incomprehensible : The city that I come from lives under command Of one man , not a rabble The common man !
Singers like Dennis Brown have taken up Marley 's mantle ; so too have the growing number of rap poets whose patois English is well-nigh incomprehensible to non-Jamaican ears .

The old lady , following Sandison into the tiny bedroom , dropped to her knees , crossed herself and started up a high-pitched wailing , interspersed with fragments of speech which Sandison found completely incomprehensible .
Although very occasionally incomprehensible , Maria Ashcher 's translation captures the elegance and subtlety of the original .
All of this is totally incomprehensible to the woman , who wants unification as soon as possible .
But as a use of language , as an utterance , presented like this in isolation , it is quite incomprehensible , because we can not attach any meaning to it .
Her remarks about independence were totally incomprehensible to him .
To foreigners , no matter how generously equipped with dictionaries , the everyday language of everyday people is incomprehensible .
That attitude is incomprehensible in hon. Members who say that they wish to represent the interests of the consumers in their constituency .
the number or position of lines make the picture incomprehensible .
The Captain frowned and murmured something sufficiently incomprehensible for her to take it as a negative .
Without punctuation , reading becomes tiresome and the text incomprehensible .
